subject: Re: [junit] Categories in 4.8, how can I avoid specifying classes in 	@Suite.SuiteClasses
msgSnippet: ... Take a look at the cpsuite extension, which should take care of that. ... We don t contribute time or opinion to the maven project, so it s hard to say.
messageBody:
On Thu, Dec 10, 2009 at 2:51 AM, baardl <bard.lind@...> wrote:
>
> Hi.
>
> I have been trying to use TestNG for a while, but found the transition a bit
> too hard :-)
>
> Categories in junit is looking promising, but there is two things that stops
> me from implementing this into
> our current project.
> 1. How can I run tests in an category, without needing to add all my test
> classes to the @... annotation?
> Needing to add a new testclass to a suite will over time guarantee that we
> loose (forget to add) some tests.

Take a look at the cpsuite extension, which should take care of that.

> 2. Will there be a Maven 2 support for running test in a single category?
> Like
> -Dtest.category=SlowTest,FastTest

We don't contribute time or opinion to the maven project, so it's hard
to say. Sorry,

David Saff
